data.enText: a place where a lot of people go on holiday/vacation

data.chText: 海滨、滑雪、山区等度假胜地
人们经常光顾的拜伦贝城
data.enText: the resort town of Byron Bay
the act of using sth, especially sth bad or unpleasant, because nothing else is possible

data.chText: 冲突有望不需要诉诸武力而得到解决。
data.enText: There are hopes that the conflict can be resolved without resort to violence.

data.chText: 应急措施；可首先（或最后）采取的手段
data.enText: the first or last course of action that you should or can take in a particular situation

data.chText: 罢工应该是最后一着，在所有的谈判努力都告失败时才使用。
data.enText: Strike action should be regarded as a last resort , when all attempts to negotiate have failed.

data.chText: 最后人人都得自己作决定。
data.enText: In the last resort (= in the end) everyone must decide for themselves.
to make use of sth, especially sth bad, as a means of achieving sth, often because there is no other possible solution

data.chText: 他们觉得有必要诉诸暴力。
data.enText: They felt obliged to resort to violence.

data.chText: 我们也许只能使用未受过训练的员工了。
data.enText: We may have to resort to using untrained staff.

means: 可首先(或最后)采取的手段

data.enText: to make use of sth, especially sth bad, as a means of achieving sth, often because there is no other possible solution

data.chText: 他们觉得有必要诉诸暴力。
data.enText: They felt obliged to resort to violence.

data.chText: 我们也许只能使用未受过训练的员工了。
data.enText: We may have to resort to using untrained staff.

tr: act of turning to for assistance
example: an appeal to his uncle was his last resort

tr: something or someone turned to for assistance or security
example: his only recourse was the police

tr: a hotel located in a resort area
move, travel, or proceed toward some place
example: He repaired to his cabin in the woods
The government resorted to rationing meat

value.def: If you resort to a course of action that you do not really approve of, you adopt it because you cannot see any other way of achieving what you want.

example.ex: His punishing work schedule had made him resort to drugs...
example.tran: 异常紧张的工作安排使他开始吸毒。

example.ex: Some schools have resorted to recruiting teachers from overseas.
example.tran: 有些学校不得不开始从海外招收老师。

value.def: If you achieve something without resort to a particular course of action, you succeed without carrying out that action. To have resort to a particular course of action means to have to do that action in order to achieve something.

example.ex: Congress has a responsibility to ensure that all peaceful options are exhausted before resort to war.
example.tran: 国会有责任确保只有在所有和平手段都不奏效的情况下才会诉诸战争。

value.def: A resort is a place where a lot of people spend their holidays.
If you do something as a last resort, you do it because you can find no other way of getting out of a difficult situation or of solving a problem.

example.ex: Nuclear weapons should be used only as a last resort...
example.tran: 不到万不得已时不能选择使用核武器。

example.ex: As a last resort you may have to accept their point of view.
example.tran: 最终，你可能不得不接受他们的观点。

value.def: You use in the last resort when stating the most basic or important fact that will still be true in a situation whatever else happens.

example.ex: They would in the last resort support their friends whatever they did.
example.tran: 无论他们的朋友做了什么，他们最终都会支持他们的朋友。

trans: 终极手段；终极审判；最后手段；最后的手段；最后一招
